item.about: GaikBot is a chatbot, sort of like the "sequel" to Dank Sinatra. He is written in C#, and uses the Microsoft Bot Framework to integrate him with various channels, including SMS, Facebook, and Telegram.
item.name: GaikBot

item.about: Braino is another chatbot. Whenever he recieves a message, Braino searches a database which has been filled with conversations from Facebook and responds with the next thing said.
item.name: Braino

item.about: I am the Official webmaster for Math Club, the umbrella organization for all undergraduate societies within the Mathematics Departament at Texas A&M. I was unanimously elected, and I created the first website for the club from scratch, which is currently hosted here but will soon be hosted on the Math Department servers.
item.name: Math Club Website

item.about: AsciiArt takes a picture and transforms it into text.
item.name: AsciiArt

item.about: PolyRoot is a Mathematica library which impliments various root-finding algorithms. The source code can be found here.
item.name: PolyRoot

item.about: A basic Markov text generator written in C++. View the source code here. I also created an implementation in PHP here.
item.name: Markov Text Generator

item.about: I helped design and implement the website for Aggie Coding Club. I worked with a group of about 10 other students.
item.name: Aggie Coding Club Website

item.about: Ilumi-Therapy is an android app that me and my team created for HackDFW. It is based on the concept of Light Therapy, an emerging field in medical science. It was created using the Ilumi Smart Bulb SDK, and it won us first place in Ilumi's contest for the most creative use of their SDK at the hackathon. The source code can be found here.
item.name: IlumiTherapy

item.about: Based on Flap God, Flap God 2 is a game about pancake sorting. The object of the game is to get the pancakes sorted from smallest to largest in as few flips as possible. Works best on Google Chrome.
item.name: Flap God 2

item.about: Enter three sides of the triangle and, using Heron's formula, this will calculate the area and draw the triangle. Click here for the source code.
item.name: Triangle Calculator

item.about: Bubbles will float around aimlessly, heading the opposite direction whenever colliding with a wall or another bubble. Works best on Google Chrome. Click here for the source code.
item.name: Bubble

item.about: Dank Sinatra is a Facebook chatbot. He is written in JavaScript (using Node.js) and a smidgen of Python. Type '\help' to see a list of his available commands. He also pushes relevant messages to a database, sends me email updates, and posts weather updates every 3 hours, but new features are constantly being added. I hope to one day make him a full-on companion, such as Siri or Watson (albiet not as realistic). For more information, see here.
item.name: Dank Sinatra
